page.title: 05Drill Rig -Thorpe Salvin
page.content: In April 1985 I was taking the dog for a walk and I noticed that they were making a structure at the end of {Southards Lane.}The next day I saw it was a drill rig. We wrote to the coal board to ask for some information about the drill rig. A few days later we got a reply from the{National Coal Board}colliery surveyor. In the letter it says that they were looking for samples of the coal seam in the rock. They make a hole 12.5 cm in diameter and the borehole is 810 m in depth. It was up for one month but now it has been taken down, although machines that were taking samples stayed for some time.
